connector.description: Perform machine learning tasks using Weka.

camel.sink.path.command.name: camel.sink.path.command
camel.sink.path.command.description: The command to use. One of: [filter] [model] [read] [write] [push] [pop] [version]

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.dsname.name: camel.sink.endpoint.dsname
camel.sink.endpoint.dsname.description: The named dataset to train the classifier with

camel.sink.endpoint.folds.name: camel.sink.endpoint.folds
camel.sink.endpoint.folds.description: Number of folds to use for cross-validation

camel.sink.endpoint.loadFrom.name: camel.sink.endpoint.loadFrom
camel.sink.endpoint.loadFrom.description: Path to load the model from

camel.sink.endpoint.saveTo.name: camel.sink.endpoint.saveTo
camel.sink.endpoint.saveTo.description: Path to save the model to

camel.sink.endpoint.seed.name: camel.sink.endpoint.seed
camel.sink.endpoint.seed.description: An optional seed for the randomizer

camel.sink.endpoint.xval.name: camel.sink.endpoint.xval
camel.sink.endpoint.xval.description: Flag on whether to use cross-validation with the current dataset

camel.sink.endpoint.path.name: camel.sink.endpoint.path
camel.sink.endpoint.path.description: An in/out path for the read/write commands

camel.component.weka.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.weka.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.weka.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.weka.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.weka.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.weka.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
